alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Crawford; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 29 at 3:04AM CDT until October 31 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 possible. * WHERE...Clark, Jasper, Crawford, Clay, Richland and Lawrence Counties. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This will likely mark the end to the growing season for southeast Illinois.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Crawford; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland
